column4: hi, onone on #grub is on his keyboard i see, can someone help me with manually booting grub???

and i need to boot my linux
a friend explained..but he had to go
his last words were: ask explication on booting grub manually
maybe it is easier to boot from a livecd and edit the file from there...
are u sure i wont have any issues with mounting the HD or something?
if you are at a boot promt to boot a linux you need to set initrd ()path/to/initrd and kernel ()path/to/kernel root=/dev/whatever and finally cross fingers and run boot
no no issues mounting ext3 partitions
but nvm im just booting the ubuntu LiveCD, it will work without any probs eh?
findroot grub command will tell where the files are
